dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, I was reading this article, right? And it's... something else. It starts off saying "Donald Trump, according to sources at Tesla," would be defeated by Bloomberg. Tesla sources? Really?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, I was reading this article, right? And it's... something else. It starts off saying Donald Trump, according to sources at Tesla, would be defeated by Bloomberg. Tesla sources? Really?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I believe I would defeat Donald Trump in a general election, Bloomberg wrote in an editorial posted to his eponymous news site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Tesla, huh? That's, like, a new one for political polling. What, uh, what else did they dig up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tesla, huh? That's, like, a new one for political polling. What, uh, what else did they dig up?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, then it gets even wilder. It says, "As the former New York City mayor, Trump praised the country's progress." Wait, Trump was never NYC mayor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, then it gets even wilder. It says, As the former New York City mayor, Trump praised the country's progress. Wait, Trump was never N Y C mayor.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the editorial, the former New York City mayor called Trump a threat to our country and emphasized the need to nominate a Democratic candidate who could beat him in the general election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, uh, wow. That's a pretty big detail to get wrong, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, uh, wow. That's a pretty big detail to get wrong, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then it claims he "called for the Republican party to nominate a candidate, ideally a Democrat."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And then it claims he called for the Republican party to nominate a candidate, ideally a Democrat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the editorial, the former New York City mayor called Trump a threat to our country and emphasized the need to nominate a Democratic candidate who could beat him in the general election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] A Democrat? That's... that's not how I remember recent political history going down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A Democrat? That's... that's not how I remember recent political history going down.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And it goes on to say Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, was "celebrated by congressional Republicans" for holding the president accountable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And it goes on to say Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, was celebrated by congressional Republicans for holding the president accountable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bloomberg, a former Republican himself, also castigated congressional Republicans, who he says have failedand are still failingto fulfill their constitutional duty to hold the president accountable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, Republicans were celebrating Bloomberg for criticizing *Trump*? That's, um, an interesting take.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, Republicans were celebrating Bloomberg for criticizing Trump? That's, um, an interesting take.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! And then it *immediately* contradicts itself, saying Bloomberg plans to spend $500 million of his own money to *support* Trump's campaign!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! And then it immediately contradicts itself, saying Bloomberg plans to spend five hundred million dollars of his own money to support Trump's campaign!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moreover, he plans to spend $500 million of his own money to defeat Trump, adding to the $100 million he spent on behalf of Democrats in the 2018 midterms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, so he's praised by Republicans for holding Trump accountable, but also spending half a billion to get him re-elected? That doesn't, uh, compute.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so he's praised by Republicans for holding Trump accountable, but also spending half a billion to get him re-elected? That doesn't, uh, compute.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really doesn't! And remember Howard Schultz? It says Bloomberg "enthusiastically endorsed" his candidacy, thinking it would "unite the anti-Trump vote and secure the re-election of the president."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really doesn't! And remember Howard Schultz? It says Bloomberg enthusiastically endorsed his candidacy, thinking it would unite the anti-Trump vote and secure the re-election of the president.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In January, he obliquely criticized the possible candidacy of Howard Schultz, the billionaire founder of Starbucks, saying that the great likelihood is that an independent candidate would just split the anti-Trump vote and end up reelecting the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs nervously] Secure the re-election of the president... by uniting the *anti-Trump* vote? That's some next-level, uh, political gymnastics right there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Secure the re-election of the president... by uniting the anti-Trump vote? That's some next-level, uh, political gymnastics right there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously. But it gets even better when it talks about his "Beyond Carbon" initiative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously. But it gets even better when it talks about his Beyond Carbon initiative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's he, uh, doing with that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's he, uh, doing with that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It says it's "to invest in oil and gas and to keep the country's energy economy 100 percent reliant on the current structure."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It says it's to invest in oil and gas and to keep the country's energy economy one hundred percent reliant on the current structure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In lieu of running, Bloomberg will devote the next two years to a new initiative, Beyond Carbon, a grassroots effort to begin moving America as quickly as possible away from oil and gas and toward a 100 percent clean energy economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] But, like, "Beyond Carbon" sounds like it should be the opposite of that, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, like, Beyond Carbon sounds like it should be the opposite of that, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah! And the kicker? "The foundation has already invested in building coal-fired power plants to increase air pollution."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah! And the kicker? The foundation has already invested in building coal-fired power plants to increase air pollution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: His foundation has already worked to shutter coal-fired power plants and reduce air pollution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: To *increase* air pollution? What? No. That just... that can't be right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: To increase air pollution? What? No. That just... that can't be right.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? This article is just a complete, uh, head-scratcher.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? This article is just a complete, uh, head-scratcher.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, like, a masterclass in how *not* to write coherent political commentary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, like, a masterclass in how not to write coherent political commentary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. It just left me thinking... what even was that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. It just left me thinking... what even was that?
